item.title: Shadows Has Almost Beaten The Entire Series on Steam in One Day
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/shadows-has-almost-beaten-the-entire-series-on-steam-in-one-day/

Assassin’s Creed Shadows was released today, March 20, and it’s already climbed Steam’s all-time player peak charts to become third in series history. 

According to SteamDB (via Games Radar), Assassin’s Creed Shadows is off to a great start on Steam, achieving an all-time player peak of 41,412 on the first day (at the time of writing). To compare, Shadows has more than doubled AC Valhalla’s numbers, which peaked at 15,679 2.3 years ago. It is less than 150 players away from beating AC Origins’ peak, 41,551, which arrived 7.4 years ago. AC Odyssey still stands strong at the moment, peaking at 62,069 6.4 years ago. 

Regarding AC Shadows reviews on Steam, things seem to be going well for Ubisoft, with the platform categorising it as “Very Positive”. If you are interested in an in-depth review of Assassin’s Creed Shadows, you can check out Insider Gaming’s review of the title, where we described the game as “Great, But The Blade Still Needs Sharpening”. 

Assassin’s Creed Shadows is the latest instalment of Ubisoft’s popular series. For those unaware of the game, the new setting takes players to Feudal Japan, where they explore a fresh narrative set in a vast open world through the eyes of dual protagonists.

The new protagonists are Yasuke and Naoe, both featuring distinct playstyles. One is a stealthy Assassin, and the other is a legendary Samurai; players must master both characters to take down enemies with precision and power. The game also introduces a fully customisable hideout where you train your crew, craft/upgrade weapons, and interact with characters. 

In other news, the Japanese government worries about ‘imitation attacks’ based on Assassin’s Creed Shadows. Also, here’s where to find all the Legendary Animals in the game. What are your thoughts on AC Shadows almost beating the entire series on Steam in one day? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

item.title: Hideo Kojima Addresses “Online Negativity” Over Lowest-Rated Metal Gear Solid Game in The Series
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/hideo-kojima-addresses-online-negativity-over-lowest-rated-metal-gear-solid-game-in-the-series/

Nearly 11 years after its release, Hideo Kojima has taken to X to express his feelings over the negative feedback that Metal Gear Solid Ground Zeroes received when it was released.

Hideo Kojima is one of the finest auteurs of his generation across all mediums. His calculated approach to cinematic presentation and innovation has accompanied the director across his multi-decade career. Metal Gear Solid is arguably his crowning achievement, and many of the entries are some of the most heralded releases in the annals of gaming history.

One entry has proved divisive. Although it’s looked upon more favorably in hindsight, Ground Zeroes was the subject of much criticism when it first launched.

Metal Gear Solid Ground Zeroes was considered a “Prologue to the new gameplay” of Metal Gear Solid Phantom Pain, and it was originally supposed to be part of The Phantom Pain. However, as Kojima puts it in his statement on X: “The PS4 was released and there were only a few titles out, so just GZ was released ahead of the others.”

Kojima and Konami opted to release it as a standalone piece of bite-sized action, and Ground Zeroes looked and played incredibly—thanks to the new and improved Fox Engine. But its brief runtime was an inescapable negative at the time.

Reflecting, Kojima has said: “Although the episodes were short, we threw in as many gameplay elements as possible. Although it is recognized now, 11 years later, there was online negativity at the time saying, “Selling a demo version at a low price?” and it received the lowest rating in the MGS series.”

Already 11 years ago😅 This was originally planned to demonstrate the FOX engine and the gameplay of an open world infiltration game. I thought of it as an episode connecting PW and MGSV TPP, to be a bridge for both generations (console and handheld). We were considering

It’s clear that Hideo Kojima is proud of the work, and it’s fair because Ground Zeroes was a great—if not compact—MGS experience. The original plan would happen sometime later as Metal Gear Solid V: Definitive Experience was released. It bundles Ground Zeroes and The Phantom Pain into one complete MGS package.

Kojima has moved on from MGS with Death Stranding. A successor—Death Stranding 2—is due to release in 2025. Whereas the MGS series moves on without Kojima in Metal Gear Solid Delta Snake Eater.

item.title: Can I Play Inzoi on Mac?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/can-i-play-inzoi-on-mac/

Inzoi is shaping up to be one of the most fire releases of 2025. Its blend of life-simulation mechanics and lifelike graphics combine to create one of the most unique experiences, but Mac users are wondering if they’re being excluded.

You’d be hard-pressed to find anyone to argue with The Sims being the life-sim series. Its lifetime revenue and sales are head and shoulders into the sky in the hundreds of millions. It’s a tough task for newcomers, but we know there’s a lot of interest in Inzoi—a new life simulator game headed by Inzoi Studio and Krafton.

Inzoi’s more realistic take on graphics is already a huge plus in its favor. However, for Inzoi’s platforms and the game’s availability, we need to see if everything is as rosy.

Is Inzoi Playable on Mac?

Inzoi is not playable on Mac when it launches in Early Access as it stands.

The current platforms locked in for Inzoi are PCs (not Macs), PlayStation, and Xbox—although the latter two ports are only arriving much later on. Even though PCs and Macs are considered similar formats, there’s still a world of difference between them, and Macs usually get the short end of the stick.

If you want to play Inzoi anytime soon, you need to invest in a PC. Make sure you check out the different levels of system requirements for Inzoi before you do to ensure you meet its PC Specs.

Why Isn’t Inzoi on Mac?

There are two possible reasons for Inzoi not being on Mac: The game starting out in Early Access, or Macs struggling to run Inzoi.

If you check out the system requirements above, you can see even the minimum requirements are tough. I would wager there’s concerns at Inzoi Studio about the game running on Macs. This is one big possibility for the lack of a Mac presence.

The other reason is a Mac version may arrive later down the line. To reiterate, even the PlayStation and Xbox are missing out initially. Many Early Access games opt for a PC-only release at launch. Once Inzoi starts finalizing its official debut, we may hear more about a Mac version.

As always, we’ll update you if there are any developments regarding an Inzoi Mac port. Leave a comment to let us know your thoughts on Invoi, and head to our Insider Gaming forum to discuss it with other users.

We have more Inzoi information including if it’s got multiplayer and how much it costs.
